p: From a total of 231 plants inventoried, 227 species could be identified and classified in 192 genera and 79 families. Families representing most species were Fabaceae (27 species, i.e., 11.9%), Euphorbiaceae (13 species, i.e., 5.7%), Rubiaceae (12 species, i.e., 5.3%), Asteraceae and Lamiaceae (each with 11 species, i.e., 4.8%), and Solanaceae (10 species, i.e., 4.4%). The other 73 families were represented by less than 10 species (Table 2).
